great white shark: A large, predatory shark with sharp teeth.
hammerhead shark: A shark with a hammer-shaped head.
stingray: A flat fish with a long, venomous tail.
hen: A female chicken, often laying eggs.
ostrich: A large flightless bird with long legs.
goldfinch: A small songbird with yellow and black feathers.
junco: A small bird with gray or brown feathers.
bald eagle: A large bird of prey with a white head.
vulture: A large bird that feeds on carrion.
smooth newt: A small amphibian with smooth skin.
axolotl: A salamander that retains its gills throughout life.
tree frog: A small frog that lives in trees.
green iguana: A large green lizard often kept as a pet.
chameleon: A lizard known for changing its skin color.
Indian cobra: A venomous snake with a hooded appearance.
scorpion: An arachnid with pincers and a venomous sting.
centipede: A multi-legged arthropod with venomous claws.
peafowl: A bird known for its colorful tail feathers.
lorikeet: A small, colorful parrot with a brush-tipped tongue.
hummingbird: A tiny bird that hovers while feeding on nectar.
toucan: A bird with a large, colorful beak.
duck: A waterfowl with webbed feet and a broad bill.
goose: A large waterfowl with a long neck.
black swan: A large waterbird with black feathers.
koala: A tree-dwelling marsupial that eats eucalyptus leaves.
jellyfish: A soft-bodied marine animal with tentacles.
snail: A mollusk with a coiled shell.
American lobster: A large crustacean with big claws.
hermit crab: A crab that lives in a discarded shell.
flamingo: A tall bird with pink feathers and long legs.
great egret: A large white heron with long legs.
pelican: A large water bird with a long beak and throat pouch.
king penguin: A large penguin with bright orange markings.
grey whale: A large baleen whale with a gray body.
sea lion: A marine mammal with external ear flaps.
Chihuahua: A small dog breed with a short coat.
Shih Tzu: A small dog with a long, flowing coat.
Afghan Hound: A tall dog with long, flowing fur.
Basset Hound: A dog with long ears and short legs.
Beagle: A small hound dog with a keen sense of smell.
Bloodhound: A large dog known for its strong tracking abilities.
Italian Greyhound: A small, slender dog with a short coat.
Whippet: A small, fast dog resembling a greyhound.
Weimaraner: A large, sleek dog with a gray coat.
Yorkshire Terrier: A small dog with a long, silky coat.
Boston Terrier: A small, muscular dog with a short coat.
Scottish Terrier: A small dog with a wiry coat and pointed ears.
West Highland White Terrier: A small terrier with a white, wiry coat.
Golden Retriever: A large dog with a thick, golden coat.
Labrador Retriever: A large dog with a short coat, known for retrieving.
Cocker Spaniel: A small spaniel with a long, silky coat.
collie: A medium-sized herding dog with a long or short coat.
Border Collie: A medium-sized herding dog known for its intelligence.
Rottweiler: A large, strong dog with a black and tan coat.
Boxer: A medium-large, muscular dog with a short coat.
French Bulldog: A small, muscular dog with bat-like ears.
St. Bernard: A large, gentle dog known for its rescue work in the mountains.
Siberian Husky: A medium-sized sled dog with a thick coat.
Dalmatian: A medium-sized dog with a white coat covered in black spots.
pug: A small dog with a wrinkled face and short coat.
Pomeranian: A small, fluffy dog with a thick coat.
Chow Chow: A medium-sized dog with a thick coat and blue-black tongue.
Pembroke Welsh Corgi: A small herding dog with short legs and no tail.
Toy Poodle: The smallest variety of poodle, with a curly coat.
Standard Poodle: The largest poodle breed with a curly coat.
grey wolf: The largest wild member of the dog family.
hyena: A large carnivore known for its powerful jaws.
red fox: A small wild canid with a red coat.
tabby cat: A domestic cat with a striped coat.
leopard: A large wild cat with a spotted coat.
snow leopard: A large wild cat adapted to cold, mountainous regions.
lion: A large wild cat known for its mane.
tiger: A large wild cat with a striped coat.
cheetah: A large wild cat known for its speed.
polar bear: A large bear species adapted to the Arctic.
meerkat: A small, social mammal that lives in desert regions.
ladybug: A small beetle with a red and black-spotted shell.
fly: A small insect with two wings.
bee: An insect known for pollination and honey production.
ant: A small social insect that lives in colonies.
grasshopper: An insect that jumps and feeds on plants.
cockroach: A nocturnal insect known for its hardiness.
praying mantis: An insect known for its predatory hunting stance.
dragonfly: A fast-flying insect with long, slender wings.
monarch butterfly: A large, orange and black migratory butterfly.
starfish: A sea creature with five arms.
cottontail rabbit: A small rabbit with a fluffy white tail.
porcupine: A rodent with sharp quills for defense.
fox squirrel: A large tree squirrel with a bushy tail.
beaver: A large rodent known for building dams.
guinea pig: A small, social rodent often kept as a pet.
zebra: A wild horse with black and white stripes.
pig: A domesticated animal raised for meat.
hippopotamus: A large, semi-aquatic mammal with a huge mouth.
llama: A domesticated South American pack animal.
skunk: A small mammal known for its foul-smelling spray.
badger: A burrowing mammal with a strong build.
chimpanzee: A highly intelligent ape closely related to humans.
gibbon: A small, agile ape known for its long arms.
giant panda: A large bear-like mammal known for eating bamboo.
clownfish: A small, colorful fish that lives in anemones.
pufferfish: A fish that inflates when threatened.
accordion: A portable musical instrument with keys and bellows.
ambulance: A vehicle used to transport people in need of medical care.
assault rifle: A rapid-fire rifle designed for military use.
backpack: A bag worn on the back, used for carrying items.
barn: A large building used for storing farm equipment and animals.
wheelbarrow: A small hand-propelled vehicle for carrying loads.
basketball: A large ball used in the sport of basketball.
bathtub: A large container for taking baths.
lighthouse: A tall structure with a light to guide ships.
beer glass: A glass used for drinking beer.
binoculars: A handheld device for viewing distant objects.
birdhouse: A small house for birds to live in.
broom: A tool used for sweeping floors.
bucket: A round container with a handle, used for carrying liquids.
cauldron: A large metal pot used for cooking over an open fire.
candle: A stick of wax with a wick, used for lighting.
cannon: A large gun used in warfare.
canoe: A lightweight boat paddled by hand.
carousel: A rotating amusement ride with seats for passengers.
castle: A large fortified building or group of buildings.
mobile phone: A handheld device used for communication.
cowboy hat: A wide-brimmed hat associated with cowboys.
electric guitar: A guitar that requires an amplifier to produce sound.
fire truck: A vehicle used by firefighters to fight fires.
flute: A woodwind instrument played by blowing air.
gas mask or respirator: A mask worn to protect from harmful gases.
guillotine: A machine used for execution by beheading.
hammer: A tool used for driving nails into materials.
harmonica: A small wind instrument played by blowing air.
harp: A large string instrument played by plucking.
hatchet: A small axe used for chopping.
joystick: A control stick used for video games or machines.
lab coat: A protective coat worn by scientists or doctors.
lawn mower: A machine used to cut grass.
lipstick: A cosmetic used to color the lips.
mailbox: A box where mail is collected and delivered.
missile: guided weapon designed to hit a target
mitten: A glove that covers the hand with a single space for fingers.
parachute: device used to slow a fall from the sky
pickup truck: vehicle with an open cargo area
pirate ship: vessel used by pirates for sailing and attacking
rugby ball: oval ball used in the sport of rugby
saxophone: wind instrument used in jazz and classical music
schooner: large sailing ship with multiple masts
soccer ball: round ball used in the sport of soccer
space shuttle: vehicle used for traveling to space
scarf: garment worn around the neck for warmth or style
tank: armored military vehicle with a large gun
tennis ball: small rubber ball used in tennis
tractor: vehicle used in farming to pull machinery
trombone: brass instrument with a sliding mechanism
violin: stringed instrument played with a bow
military aircraft: aircraft used by the military for combat or transport
ice cream: A frozen dessert made from cream.
bagel: A round bread roll with a hole in the middle.
cabbage: A leafy vegetable, often green or purple.
broccoli: A green vegetable with a tree-like shape.
cucumber: A long, green vegetable often used in salads.
bell pepper: A sweet, crunchy pepper available in different colors.
mushroom: A fungus with a stalk and cap.
strawberry: A small, red, sweet fruit with seeds on the outside.
pineapple: A tropical fruit with spiky skin and sweet flesh.
banana: A long, curved fruit with soft, sweet flesh.
pomegranate: A fruit with a tough rind and juicy seeds inside.
pizza: A dish of dough topped with sauce, cheese, and toppings.
burrito: A tortilla wrapped around a filling.
volcano: A mountain that erupts with lava.
scuba diver: A person who dives underwater with breathing equipment.
acorn: A nut from an oak tree.
